snippet: The program is aimed at people fleeing El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras and would involve setting up processing centers in several other Latin American countries.
abstract: Obama administration officials say United Nations refugee agency will work with United States to offer temporary safety to migrants fleeing violence in Central America by attempting to cross into US illegally over southern border; processing centers in several Latin American nations would  assess migrants for refugee status and offer range of resettlement options.

byline.original: By JULIA PRESTON, DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: The program is aimed at people fleeing El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras and would involve setting up processing centers in several other Latin American countries.

headline.main: U.N. to Help U.S. Screen Central American Migrants
headline.print_headline: U.N. to Help U.S. Screen Immigrants for Resettling
